title: How to Make a Military Bun

steps.title: Make a ponytail
steps.content: Make a ponytail in the middle of the back of your head. Secure it with a thick ponytail holder that you wrap at least 3-4 times around your hair. The ponytail should be very tight and close to your scalp.

steps.title: Wrap a second ponytail holder around the ponytail.
steps.content: Wrap a second ponytail holder around the ponytail. In case the first one breaks or loses its elasticity, you'll be prepared. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Lift up the ponytail as you begin to twist it.
steps.content: Lift up the ponytail as you begin to twist it. Hold it up as you twist the ponytail tightly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap the twisted ponytail around itself.
steps.content: Wrap the twisted ponytail around itself. Starting at the base of the ponytail, take the twisted ponytail and wrap it around itself as much as you need to until it is completely wrapped. Make sure there are no loose strands and that your hair is neatly wrapped without bumps. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the bun with 3-4 large bobby pins.
steps.content: Secure the bun with 3-4 large bobby pins . Start securing the hair at the top of the bun, pushing the pins down to secure the bun to the rest of your hair. Try moving your head aroundâ€”if the bun doesn't feel completely secure, try using a few more bobby pins until you can move your head in all directions without the bun moving out of place. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place a hairnet over the bun (optional).
steps.content: Place a hairnet over the bun (optional). For an additional touch, you can place a hairnet over the bun, doubling it two or three times depending on the size of the bun.

steps.title: Secure the hairnet in place.
steps.content: Secure the hairnet in place. Use at least 2-3 small pins to secure the hairnet in place.

steps.title: Spray the bun with hairspray.
steps.content: Spray the bun with hairspray . Smooth any flyaways with a little gel. Keep the hairspray with you throughout the day just in case you need to secure your look later.

steps.title: Brush your hair thoroughly.
steps.content: Brush your hair thoroughly. Spend a good few minutes running a brush through your hair until it feels smooth and completely tangle-free. Make sure that this is the first thing you do; if you brush your hair after you wash it, you'll be more likely to break and damage your hair.

steps.title: Wet your hair.
steps.content: Wet your hair. You can use shampoo and conditioner if you need it, but the main purpose of wetting the hair is to make it easier to work with.

steps.title: Dry your hair until it's damp.
steps.content: Dry your hair until it's damp. Dry your hair with a towel and wring it out until it's nice and damp. If it's soaking wet, it will be hard to make a bun, but you won't be able to do it if your hair is completely dry, so don't blow dry it or wait to long before you make your bun.

steps.title: Comb your hair gently to get all the bumps out.
steps.content: Comb your hair gently to get all the bumps out. Put a dime-sized amount of hair gel onto the comb and run it through your hair.
